summary: This is an internal FBI email chain discussing media inquiries about Prince Andrew's cooperation with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The emails show FBI personnel coordinating a response to media reports that US Attorney Geoff Berman stated Prince Andrew had not responded to requests for an interview.

persons.name: Geoff Berman
persons.context: Mentioned as having held a media availability where he stated that federal prosecutors and the FBI had asked to interview Prince Andrew about Jeffrey Epstein, but Prince Andrew had not responded.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The email discusses media reports that US authorities have asked to interview him regarding Jeffrey Epstein, but he has not responded despite a public offer to cooperate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation into Epstein is the reason federal prosecutors and the FBI are seeking to interview Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Aaron Kertersky
persons.context: Source of the initial information; his Twitter feed reported on US Attorney Geoff Berman's media availability.

connections.description: Federal prosecutors and the FBI sought to interview Prince Andrew in connection with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
As US Attorney, Berman publicly stated that his office and the FBI had requested an interview with Prince Andrew regarding Epstein.

events.title: Media Report on Prince Andrew Interview Request
events.description: US Attorney Geoff Berman stated at a media availability that federal prosecutors and the FBI had asked to interview Prince Andrew about Jeffrey Epstein, but Prince Andrew had not responded.

events.title: FBI Internal Coordination on Media Inquiry
events.description: FBI personnel exchanged emails to coordinate a response to media inquiries following reports about Prince Andrew's lack of response to interview requests.

keyFacts: US Attorney Geoff Berman publicly stated that Prince Andrew had not responded to requests from federal prosecutors and the FBI for an interview regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
The FBI's New York field office was coordinating a media response, planning to refer inquiries to the US Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) and not engage directly.
The information originated from journalist Aaron Kertersky's Twitter feed, which reported on Berman's media availability.
The email chain reveals internal FBI strategy to handle press inquiries with a 'no comment' stance or by directing calls to the US Attorney's Office.
